neurotools.functions module¶

neurotools.functions.slog(x, eps=3.7433921782255195601e-23, returntype=<type 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

Safe natural logarithm Natural logarithm that truncates inputs to small positive value epsilon (eps, default 1e-6) to avoid underflow in the output.

neurotools.functions.sexp(x, limit=26.641747557046326023, returntype=<type 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

Safe exponential

neurotools.functions.sigmoid(x, returntype=<type 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

Soft-threshold function (rescaled hyperbolic tangent) More numerically stable version

neurotools.functions.g(x, returntype=<type 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

Evaluates g(x)=log(1+exp(x)) as accurately as possible.

neurotools.functions.f(x, returntype=<type 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

evaluates f(x)=1/(1+exp(-x)) as accurately as possible

neurotools.functions.f1(x, returntype=<type 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

Fist derivative of sigmoid

neurotools.functions.f2(x, returntype=<type 'numpy.float64'>)[source]¶

Second derivative of sigmoid

(q - p) p q

neurotools.functions.npdf(mu, sigma, x)[source]¶

Gaussian probability density

Parameters:
  • mu (float) – Mean of distribution
  • sigma (float) – Standard deviation of distribution
  • x (float or array-like) – Points at which to evaluate distribution
neurotools.functions.log_factorial(k)[source]¶

Returns the logarithm of a factorial by taking the sum of the logarithms of 1..N. Slow, but numerically more accurate than taking the logarithm of the factorial or using approximations.

k should be an integer.
